intro: Colicodendron gaudichaudianum, commonly known as the Gaudichaud's colicodendron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
